solution_line_template: Before the typhoon, their farm had a total of {mahogany_initial} trees + {narra_initial} trees = <<{mahogany_initial}+{narra_initial}={total_initial_trees}>>{total_initial_trees} trees.

If there was {mahogany_fell_more_than_narra} more than Mahogany than Narra tree that fell, then this means there were {narra_fell} Narra trees and {narra_fell} + {mahogany_fell_more_than_narra} = {mahogany_fell} Mahogany trees that fell during the typhoon.
So, Bea's mom planted {narra_fell} trees x {multiplier_narra_planted} = <<{narra_fell}*{multiplier_narra_planted}={narra_planted}>>{narra_planted} Narra trees.
She also planted {mahogany_fell} trees x {multiplier_mahogany_planted} = <<{mahogany_fell}*{multiplier_mahogany_planted}={mahogany_planted}>>{mahogany_planted} Mahogany trees.
So, her mom planted {narra_planted} trees + {mahogany_planted} trees = <<{narra_planted}+{mahogany_planted}={total_trees_planted}>>{total_trees_planted} more trees.
After the typhoon, they only had {total_initial_trees} trees - {total_trees_fell} trees = <<{total_initial_trees}-{total_trees_fell}={trees_after_typhoon}>>{trees_after_typhoon} trees left.
Therefore, there are {trees_after_typhoon} trees + {total_trees_planted} trees = <<{trees_after_typhoon}+{total_trees_planted}={final_total_trees}>>{final_total_trees} trees now.
